title: [BUG] doctest error in sktime.forecasting.model_selection._tune.ForecastingGridSearchCV
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
There is a ValueError in doctest for sktime.forecasting.model_selection._tune.ForecastingGridSearchCV

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->



```python
cd sktime/sktime/forecasting/model_selection
pytest _tune.py
```
Output:
```
platform linux -- Python 3.8.12, pytest-7.0.1, pluggy-1.0.0
rootdir: /root/sktime_dev/sktime, configfile: setup.cfg
plugins: cov-3.0.0, xdist-2.5.0, forked-1.4.0
collected 1 item                                                                                                    

_tune.py F                                                                                                    [100%]

===================================================== FAILURES ======================================================
____________________ [doctest] sktime.forecasting.model_selection._tune.ForecastingGridSearchCV _____________________
421     ...     },
422     ...     {
423     ...         "imputer__method": ["mean", "last"],
424     ...         "forecaster": [ExponentialSmoothing(sp=12)],
425     ...         "forecaster__trend": ["add", "mul"],
426     ...     },
427     ...     ],
428     ...     cv=cv,
429     ...     n_jobs=-1)
430     >>> gscv.fit(y)
UNEXPECTED EXCEPTION: ValueError("Input contains NaN, infinity or a value too large for dtype('float64').")
joblib.externals.loky.process_executor._RemoteTraceback: 
"""
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/joblib/externals/loky/process_executor.py", line 436, in _process_worker
    r = call_item()
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/joblib/externals/loky/process_executor.py", line 288, in __call__
    return self.fn(*self.args, **self.kwargs)
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/joblib/_parallel_backends.py", line 595, in __call__
    return self.func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/joblib/parallel.py", line 262, in __call__
    return [func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/joblib/parallel.py", line 262, in <listcomp>
    return [func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/root/sktime_dev/sktime/sktime/forecasting/model_selection/_tune.py", line 211, in _fit_and_score
    out = evaluate(
  File "/root/sktime_dev/sktime/sktime/forecasting/model_evaluation/_functions.py", line 122, in evaluate
    score = scoring(y_test, y_pred, y_train=y_train)
  File "/root/sktime_dev/sktime/sktime/performance_metrics/forecasting/_classes.py", line 154, in __call__
    return self.func(
  File "/root/sktime_dev/sktime/sktime/performance_metrics/forecasting/_functions.py", line 1548, in mean_absolute_percentage_error
    _, y_true, y_pred, multioutput = _check_reg_targets(y_true, y_pred, multioutput)
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sklearn/metrics/_regression.py", line 96, in _check_reg_targets
    y_pred = check_array(y_pred, ensure_2d=False, dtype=dtype)
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sklearn/utils/validation.py", line 801, in check_array
    _assert_all_finite(array, allow_nan=force_all_finite == "allow-nan")
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/sklearn/utils/validation.py", line 115, in _assert_all_finite
    raise ValueError(
ValueError: Input contains NaN, infinity or a value too large for dtype('float64').
"""
The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/doctest.py", line 1336, in __run
    exec(compile(example.source, filename, "single",
  File "<doctest sktime.forecasting.model_selection._tune.ForecastingGridSearchCV[23]>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/root/sktime_dev/sktime/sktime/forecasting/base/_base.py", line 160, in fit
    self._fit(y=y_inner, X=X_inner, fh=fh)
  File "/root/sktime_dev/sktime/sktime/forecasting/model_selection/_tune.py", line 260, in _fit
    results = self._run_search(evaluate_candidates)
  File "/root/sktime_dev/sktime/sktime/forecasting/model_selection/_tune.py", line 468, in _run_search
    return evaluate_candidates(ParameterGrid(self.param_grid))
  File "/root/sktime_dev/sktime/sktime/forecasting/model_selection/_tune.py", line 246, in evaluate_candidates
    out = parallel(
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/joblib/parallel.py", line 1056, in __call__
    self.retrieve()
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/joblib/parallel.py", line 935, in retrieve
    self._output.extend(job.get(timeout=self.timeout))
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/site-packages/joblib/_parallel_backends.py", line 542, in wrap_future_result
    return future.result(timeout=timeout)
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/concurrent/futures/_base.py", line 437, in result
    return self.__get_result()
  File "/root/miniconda/envs/sktime-dev/lib/python3.8/concurrent/futures/_base.py", line 389, in __get_result
    raise self._exception
ValueError: Input contains NaN, infinity or a value too large for dtype('float64').
```
**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
PASSED

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->

**Versions**
0.10.1

<!--
Please run the following code snippet and paste the output here:
 
from sktime import show_versions; show_versions()
-->

</details>

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
